channel.title: HD and still stripes?
channel.description:
I downloaded a few House episodes, and the description said that it was HD quality. But when I played it, the video was striped. I don't know how to describe it :( It looks like its either pushed into a too small screen, or it's stretched. I hope it's the first, but IDK how to check it.
I might try it on my tv with a HDMI cable tomorrow, but do you know a way to check it faster?
The .avi, for all you house fans: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4410613/House.S05E02.HDTV.XviD-NoTV.avi

item.title: HD and still stripes?

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

In WMP I get the stripes, in VLC I get a bit blurry screen and with Winamp the same as VLC. It doesn’t really bother me, but if it can be fixed, it should be fixed.

item.title: HD and still stripes?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Yea, I wasn’t thinking. Other episodes are about the same size, and they aren’t described as HD. It doesn’t matter that much, as I can see the new episodes without having to wait too long.

But can anyone explain why it’s striped? Some have it, and some don’t.

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:3, topic:253097”]http://www.godisamyth.com/house/

HD quality videos of House available w/o torrenting.[/quote]

These are large files (about 350 mb each). If you must use Winamp, turn off your equalizer to prevent skipping.

Probably the same files, but thanks anyway. I didn’t have season 1 yet, and for some reason episode 1 isn’t on the uploader’s list. But these torrents are quite fast.

Read full topic
